intro: Ferula hedgeana, commonly known as the Persian cow's milk plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that has been traditionally used in folk medicine. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, and the plant can grow up to several meters in height. Ferula hedgeana is often found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
